text: Hi James. I have made some changes to my Offcut and Jumanji shot if you wouldn't mind taking a look.  Offcut - <https://vimeo.com/405013381>  Jumanji - <https://vimeo.com/405012726>   Password: HH

Hi Harry. The offcut shot's DOF still doesn't quite work for me. It doesn't feel very natural. Feels like we should swing to character as he appears. If possible with a bit of in/out to mimic an operator finding focus. If done subtly enough that can really help a shot. The particles are moving too slowly. Zoom into some dust and film it for reference, you'll see that through a long lens like that it will appear to move quite fast. Look at the shadow too, that shadow frame left is great ref. The top would obviously be a bit softer, but not near his legs. It doesn't match at the moment.

Your Jumanji shot is looking great. Good job. I'd say the grade overall just needs some work, but it's well balanced. Try giving it a bit more contrast and play with the grade of the guy. He looks a bit dull. Jumanji is a great ref so refer to some of those shots. When I get to this stage of a comp, when I'm happy with my key and comp overall I would render out my comp with a matte and then just play with the grade off pipe. This way you can quickly play with some grade looks without being in a heavy nuke script.
